title: Solve For The Parabola
text: Given $$a x^2+bx+c=0$$. We can use quadratic formula to get $$x=\frac{\left(-b\pm \sqrt{b^2-4ac}\right)}{2} a$$. In the given parabola, $$a=4$$, $$b=4$$ and $$c=1$$.

title: Solve For The Parabola
text: Through apply the quadratic formula, we get the solution for $$f(x)=4x^2+4x+1=0$$ is $$x=-0.5$$

title: Put The Answer Into (x,y)
text: We know that $$y=0$$ in x-intercepts and we get $$x=-0.5$$ through the calculations above. Put together, we get one x-intercept $$(-0.5, 0)$$.
